intro: Onagra kunthiana, commonly known as desert sesame, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Pedaliaceae family and is characterized by its yellow flowers and linear leaves. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and high temperatures. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Onagra kunthiana is also valued for its historical use in traditional medicine and as a source of oil.
